cont.entity_a: Router reboots every few hours, even without traffic. Wireless connection drops about once per hour, requiring VPN reconnections. Frequent disconnections from all computers. Router frequently drops wireless connection and reboots.
cont.entity_b: VPN connections drop regularly. Disconnection issues after initial use.

cont.entity_a: Easy to set up with provided instructions. Problems with setup CD, but manual setup works. Easy setup and configuration for broadband use.
cont.entity_b: Easy to configure with a web interface. Secure VPN setup is easy. Easy to set up remote access with VPN.

cont.entity_a: Stable connection speed of 108Mbps with compatible hardware. Strong signal throughout a two-story house. Good range and performance through obstacles. Strong signals and great speed at a reasonable price. Signal range is poor beyond 30-50 feet.
cont.entity_b: Good for small installations (<250 users). Solid router with robust VPN capability. Reliable with long-term use across various locations.

cont.entity_a: Router failed after a short period of use. Router stopped working after three years.
cont.entity_b: Router is sturdy with full VPN features. Reliable with long-term use across various locations.

cont.entity_a: Reboots during downloads, with no resolution from firmware updates.
cont.entity_b: Firmware updates are still supported. Firmware and programming issues cause random failures.

cont.entity_a: Inexpensive and easy to set up, but not suitable for consistent connectivity needs.
Technical support is unhelpful and outsourced.
Product description is misleading regarding data transfer speed.
Older model with slow wireless speed. Router has dead spots in certain areas.
cont.entity_b: Router gets hot and needs proper ventilation. Dual WAN option works sometimes but not reliably.

cont.entity_a: Missing power adapter required additional purchase.
cont.entity_b: Easy install but not user-friendly for beginners.

Limited port forwarding capabilities. Load balancing not effective with secure connections. Dual WAN function is helpful for redundant ISP connections. Router fails with VOIP systems due to port issues.
